alert.note: Alert for Clay; Columbia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 17 at 2:59AM EST until December 17 at 3:15AM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast and northern Florida, including the following counties, in northeast Florida, Baker, Clay, Duval and St. Johns. In northern Florida, Bradford, Columbia and Union. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 257 AM EST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall across the advisory area has totaled 2 to 4 inches, with another inch or so expected. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area, especially areas susceptible to poor drainage. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jacksonville, Saint Augustine, Lake City, Orange Park, Green Cove Springs, Starke, Lake Butler, Keystone Heights, Raiford, Middleburg, Mandarin, Fruit Cove, Arlington, Unf, Ponte Vedra Beach, Ichetucknee Spring, Columbia, Taylor, Jacksonville Beach and Atlantic Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
